frame.name: Experimentation
frame.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Experimenter</fen> conducts an <fen>Experiment</fen> based on a <fen>Hypothesis</fen>. This <fen>Experiment</fen> contains a <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Control_group_member</fen> which is compared with a <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen> in order to determine the <fen>Result</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex><fex name="Experimenter">Johann's</fex> <t><fex name="Experiment">experiment</fex></t> <fex name="Result">proved the new drug was effective in treating the disease</fex>.</ex>
<ex>Jacob placed the <t><fex name="Control_group">control group</fex></t> under a strong light for 20 hours each day.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Experimenter">Rolf</fex> <t>tested</t> <fex name="Hyp">his hypothesis</fex> <fex name="Place">in Vienna</fex> <fex name="Time">in 1973</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experimenter
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Experimenter</fen> is the individual conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>. <ex><fex name="Experimenter">Justin's</fex> <t>experiment</t> turned out to be rather successful.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Experimenter">The professor</fex> performed an interesting <t>experiment</t> for the class. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Control_group
FE.definition:
<def-root>The group of entities in the <fen>Experiment</fen> which have not been treated and are compared to the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or <fen>Treated_individual</fen>. <ex></ex>
<ex>The <fex name="Control_group"><t>control</t></fex> in George's experiment consisted of 17 mice.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Control_group_member
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual entity of the <fen>Experiment</fen> which is left untreated and then compared with the <fen>Treatment_group</fen> or the <fen>Treated_individual</fen>.
<ex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Treatment_group
FE.definition: <def-root>A group of subjects that receive Treatment and are compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fex name="Controlled_individual">Controlled_individuals</fex>. <ex></ex> <ex>The <t>experiment's</t> <fex name="Treatment_group">rats who received a dose of the drug every hour</fex> did not live to see the next day. <fex name="Experimenter">DNI</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Treated_individual
FE.definition:
<def-root>An individual subject that receives treatment and is then compared to the <fen>Control_group</fen> or <fen>Controlled_individual</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Treated_individual">One rat's</fex> <t>treatment</t> caused it to outlive the rats of the control group.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The amount of time the <fen>Experiment</fen> lasts.
<ex><fex name="Duration">The six week long</fex> <t>study</t> was published in a prominent scientific journal.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Phenomenon
FE.definition: <def-root>A property that belongs to either the <fen>Control_group</fen> or the <fen>Treatment_group</fen>. Usually expressed by a PP. <ex>The <t>control</t> <fex name="Phen">for the problem of imprecise sensing</fex> is currently being monitored. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> depicts the outcome of the <fen>Experiment</fen>. <ex>The <t>experiment</t> <fex name="Result">proves the new drug is effective treating the disease</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Descriptor</fen> identifies a characteristic or description of the <fen>Experiment</fen> or the <fen>Subjects</fen> not captured by any other frame element. <ex>Mica's <fex name="Descriptor">clever</fex> <t>study</t> was conducted in 2011.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiment
FE.definition: <def-root>The test or <fen>Experiment</fen> conducted by the <fen>Experimenter</fen> using a <fen>Control_group</fen> and a <fen>Treatment_group</fen>. <ex></ex> <ex>Jeff's <t><fex name="Experiment">experiment</fex></t>showed the drug to be harmful to human health.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Hypothesis
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Hypothesis</fen> is a conjecture as to the result of an <fen>Experiment</fen>. The <fen>Experiment</fen> takes place in order to prove the <fen>Hypothesis</fen> as correct or incorrect. <ex>Katrina <t>tested</t> <fex name="Hyp">her hypothesis</fex> yesterday afternoon. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subjects
FE.definition: <def-root>In this frame <fen>Control_group</fen> and <fen>Treatment_group</fen> can be combined and expressed as <fen>Subjects</fen>. This FE can also be used for a generic individual on whom the <fen>Experiment</fen> is being conducted (see second example). <ex>They were hoping to conduct an <t>experiment</t> <fex name="Subjects">on the albino rats</fex>.</ex> <ex>The <t><fex name="Subjects">subject</fex></t> was asked to respond as quickly as possible to the stimuli in front of him.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>A tool used in conducting the <fen>Experiment</fen>. Usually expressed by a with-PP. <ex>Silke <t>experimented</t> <fex name="Inst">with chemical insecticides</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject that the <fen>Experiment</fen> is studying. <ex>Jimmy conducted an <t>experiment</t> <fex name="Topic">on tropical plants in non-tropical environments</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: control.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a subject or group of subjects in an experiment which are left untreated and are then compared with treated subjects in order to validate or invalidate a hypothesis

lexUnit.name: control group.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a group of subjects in an experiment which are left untreated and are then compared with treated subjects in order to validate or invalidate a hypothesis

lexUnit.name: experiment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a test under controlled conditions conducted in order to prove or disprove a hypothesis

lexUnit.name: study.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an experiment conducted under controlled conditions in order to prove or disprove a hypothesis

lexUnit.name: treatment.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the applying of a substance or a process in a scientific experiment to an individual or group of individuals

lexUnit.name: test.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to conduct an experiment in order to prove a hypothesis right or wrong

lexUnit.name: experiment.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to determine whether a hypothesis is correct by conducting a test or experiment

lexUnit.name: subject.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an individual who is being studied in an experiment

lexUnit.name: hypothesis.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a conjecture which explains a phenomenon and can be tested by experimentation
